The table shows the length of high-speed railways, in thousands of kilometers, in a certain country, starting in the year 2010 <math alttext="open parentheses t equals 0 close parentheses"> <mfenced> <mrow> <mi>t</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>0</mn> </mrow> </mfenced> </math>. A quartic regression is used to model the length of high-speed railways as a function of years since 2010.
content.question: What length of high-speed railways, in thousands of kilometers, is predicted by the model for 2028 <math alttext="open parentheses t equals 18 close parentheses"> <mfenced> <mrow> <mi>t</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>18</mn> </mrow> </mfenced> </math> ?

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Apply numerical results in a given mathematical or applied context.
